item.title: Welcome to Data Science for Earth
item.description: I am Babak J.Fard. A PhD candidate at Sustainability and Data Science (SDS) lab, at Northeastern University, supervised by Prof. Auroop.R Ganguly. To this date, almost all countries have ratified to the Paris Agreement on Climate Change. There is a global concern about Climate Change and the need for limiting emotions. A recent study at Yale shows that 70% of Americans think global warming is happening. Since the achievement of the agreement on Dec 2015, different activities have been organized in different capacities throughout the world to get closer to the goals of it.

item.title: Heatwave in the Town of Brookline, MA - (I) Vulnerabilities
item.description: Heatwaves are prolonged periods of high temperature that can have detrimental effects on human health, ecosystem, and power consumption. I was surprised when I learned that in the United States, the loss of human life caused by heatwaves exceeds that caused by all other weather events combined, including lightning, floods, hurricanes, and tornadoes[Klinenberg (2015)]. At that time, I was doing literature review for a project looking into the heatwaves for the town of Brookline, MA.
